text: April 19 2008 at the end of a
groundbreaking six-month mission NASA's
first female commander Peggy Whitson
undocks from the International Space
Station and hits home Peggy Whitson his
now broken the record for the American
female with the most hours in space and
she and her two crewmates they're
starting their journey back to earth
Mission Control in Korolev just outside
Moscow gives them the green light to
begin reentry just as the capsule enters
Earth's atmosphere it starts to shake
fighting smoke appears in the cabin
we got smoke in the cockpit you don't
know what it is don't know where it's
coming from there's another thing you
can do about it
this is a serious emergency
that capsule could break up at any
moment
the spacecraft is out of control and
picking up speed as it hurtles towards
Earth
they're tearing through the atmosphere
25 times the speed of sound and that's
me the g-forces can do serious damage
inside the Soyuz the crew experiences
eight times the force of Earth's gravity
crushing their bodies the uncontrolled
flight also inflicts critical damage to
the Soyuz shoe
the outside of the spacecraft is heating
up to in excess of 3,000 degrees they've
lost contact with Mission Control the
antenna has burned off there's no sign
of the capsule or the crew at the
intended landing site
Mission Control extremely concerned
publicly the Russian space agency

safe return another textbook mission
the fate of Peggy Whitson and the rest

then see a spacecraft seem to explode
it's the capsule the heat shield

tons of capsule and crew crashes down

the farmers rush over expecting to find

incredibly the three astronauts inside

it's remarkable to be able to experience
